title: ==> Warning: A dependency has updated CPATH, this may lead pkg-config to assume that the package is part of the system includes and omit it when invoked with '--cflags'
body:
*Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran Spack find to list all the installed packages and..."*

When I install packages with Spack (e.g. libfabric) I get the  message in the subject:

==> Warning: A dependency has updated CPATH, this may lead pkg-config to assume that the package is part of the system includes and omit it when invoked with '--cflags'.

It sure seems like pkg-config is ignoring a dependency, because libfabirc fails to build  with the classic "i silently failed to find an important header" error message:

```
prov/psm2/src/version.h:69:35: error: dereferencing pointer to incomplete type 'struct psm2_mq_req_user'
```

Is the CPATH warning spurious or something I should investigate further?  I was surprised to learn pkg-config is deprecated but lots of stuff I use still uses it!
